intro: Trichanthecium orinocanum, commonly known as the Orinoco thistle, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela and Colombia. It is characterized by its spiny, leafy structure and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in dry, sandy soils. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
